title: Geo3d test failure
description:
Here's how to reproduce:


ant test  -Dtestcase=TestGeo3DPoint -Dtests.method=testRandomMedium -Dtests.seed=FC3AB2BE996B411E -Dtests.multiplier=3 -Dtests.slow=true -Dtests.locale=vi -Dtests.timezone=Europe/Kaliningrad -Dtests.asserts=true -Dtests.file.encoding=US-ASCII

comments.author: Karl Wright
comments.content: First bit of diagnostic info: this is not related to bounds on a per-item level.  It may be related to what getRelationship() does.

comments.author: Karl Wright
comments.content:
Here's a far simpler test failure I can look at first that may or may not be related:


ant test  -Dtestcase=TestGeo3DPoint -Dtests.method=testGeo3DRelations -Dtests.seed=2538F7DF01B4F4CD -Dtests.multiplier=2 -Dtests.slow=true -Dtests.locale=ar-QA -Dtests.timezone=Etc/GMT-14 -Dtests.asserts=true -Dtests.file.encoding=US-ASCII

comments.author: Karl Wright
comments.content:
Michael McCandless: Attaching a patch to address the testing failures that are due solely to quantization effects.  Basically, this maps the quantized point to the surface of the ellipsoid before relying on shape.isWithin() to be meaningful.  Since the point started on the surface (before quantization), this is arguably far more accurate as a measure of test accuracy than using shape.isWithin() on the quantized point.

Better still would be to use the un-quantized point's shape.isWithin() instead as 'truth'.  Maybe I'll update the patch after I think how to do that.

comments.author: Karl Wright
comments.content:
Ok, here's a patch that should fix the test problem for real for all cases.

Basically, the test now uses unquantized point values as truth as far as the shape relationships are concerned.  This is asserted to agree with the quantized point BKD search cells and their relationship with the shape.

comments.author: Michael McCandless
comments.content:
Hmm it looks like we added test leniency back?  (We worked hard to remove this in LUCENE-7168).

I.e. in LUCENE-7168 we changed the test to only index already quantized points, so that quantization error is off the table, so that we could assert exact results after searching.

comments.author: ASF subversion and git services
comments.content:
Commit c08f6448412bde0a496758c126f493f84a944b30 in lucene-solr's branch refs/heads/master from Karl Wright
[ https://git-wip-us.apache.org/repos/asf?p=lucene-solr.git;h=c08f644 ]

LUCENE-7225: Undo unneeded conflict detection logic in test.

comments.author: Karl Wright
comments.content:
Hi Michael McCandless, you are correct about the TestRandomMedium/Small/Large suite.  I've undone that part of the commit.  What happened: I found a problem in the Relations test where you were assuming a quantized isWithin() would match an unquantized isWithin().  That's of course not going to work, so I fixed that test, and then noted what looked like similar behavior in the other suite.  However, I didn't think it through because the other suite is using isWithin of the quantized value as truth throughout, which is fine.

Should be all set now, with no leniency.

comments.author: Michael McCandless
comments.content: Phew, thank you Karl Wright!

comments.author: Karl Wright
comments.content: Chased this down to conclude that this is the result of a nonsense polygon, which crosses itself.  Detected this case now and throw IllegalArgumentException instead of creating a broken object.
